info.title: DMTools API
info.description:
DMTools Server API for presentation generation, job execution, and development management tools.

**Authentication Required**: Most endpoints require authentication. Please authenticate using one of the OAuth2 providers or JWT token below.

tags.name: Job Configurations
tags.description: API for managing saved job configurations

tags.name: Admin User Management
tags.description: Admin-only endpoints for user management and role assignment

tags.name: Chat Controller
tags.description: AI Chat API with MCP Tools Integration

tags.name: Job Execution
tags.description: API for server-managed job execution with integrated credential resolution

tags.name: Job Management
tags.description: API for executing jobs and managing configuration

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description: API for managing integrations with external systems

tags.name: MCP Configurations
tags.description: API for managing Model Context Protocol (MCP) configurations and integrations

get.description: Retrieve a specific job configuration by its ID

delete.description: Delete a job configuration by its ID

get.description: Get specific MCP configuration details
Retrieves a specific integration by its ID

put.description: Assign or update the role for a specific user. Admin access required.

400.description: Invalid role or user not found

post.summary: Execute a job in server-managed mode (async)
post.description: Starts asynchronous job execution with server-managed integration resolution and credential injection. Returns execution ID immediately.
Starts asynchronous execution of a saved job configuration by ID with optional parameter overrides. Returns execution ID immediately.

get.description: Retrieve all job configurations accessible to the authenticated user

post.description: Create a new saved job configuration
Execute a saved job configuration via webhook with API key authentication

get.description: Get all webhook API keys for this job configuration

post.description: Create a new API key for webhook authentication on this job configuration
Execute a saved job configuration with optional parameter overrides
Send a simple text message to the AI without file upload or MCP tools integration. This is a simplified endpoint for basic chat functionality.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The text message to send to the AI
parameters.example: Hello, how can you help me today?

value.content: Hello! I'm here to help you. How can I assist you today?

post.summary: Chat Completions with MCP Tools Support
post.description: Process chat messages with AI and optionally execute MCP (Multi-Cloud Platform) tools for enhanced functionality. When mcpConfigId is provided, the system can automatically select and execute relevant tools based on the conversation context.

value.content: Based on the Jira ticket DMC-123, here are the key details: [Tool execution results and AI analysis]

400.description: Invalid request - missing or empty messages

500.description: Internal server error during chat processing

value.error: Failed to process chat request: AI service unavailable

post.summary: Chat Completions with File Upload and MCP Tools
post.description: Process chat messages with uploaded files and optional MCP tools integration. Files are processed and their content is made available to the AI for analysis.

parameters.name: chatRequest
parameters.description: JSON string containing the chat request (same structure as /completions)

messages.content: Analyze the uploaded document and provide a summary

files.description: List of files to upload and analyze (optional)

400.description: Invalid request or file processing error

get.description: Retrieve all MCP configurations for authenticated user

post.description: Create new MCP configuration (pass integration IDs for MCP)

400.description: Bad request - validation errors or duplicate name

get.description: Retrieves all integrations accessible to the current user

post.description: Shares an integration with a workspace
Shares an integration with another user
Tests an integration connection with provided configuration
Executes a job with the provided parameters
Invalidates the user session and logs out the user
Authenticate user with local credentials (standalone mode only)

Re-evaluate and update all users' roles based on the current admin email configuration. This will promote users to admin if their email is in the admin list, or demote them if they're no longer admin. Admin access required.

get.summary: Get required integrations for a job
get.description: Returns the list of integrations required for the specified job
Returns detailed information about available job types including parameters and descriptions
Returns detailed information about a specific job type
Get the current status and details of a job execution by its execution ID
Returns the list of jobs available for server-managed execution
Get webhook integration examples and templates for this job configuration
Check if the chat service is running and accessible
Generate configuration code for external tools

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Output format for the configuration code

get.description: Retrieves all integrations for a specific workspace
Retrieves all available integration types
Retrieves the configuration schema for a specific integration type
Retrieves the setup documentation content for a specific integration type

404.description: Integration type or documentation not found

get.description: Retrieves non-sensitive application properties and configuration
Returns information about the currently authenticated user
Test endpoint that requires authentication
Determines if the authenticated user is a local user (not OAuth)
Retrieve a paginated list of all users with role information and optional search functionality. Admin access required.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term for email or name

delete.description: Delete a webhook API key by its ID

404.description: Job configuration or webhook key not found

delete.description: Removes an integration from a workspace
Removes a user's access to an integration

integrationIds.description: List of integration IDs to enable

items.description: List of integration IDs to enable

CreateMcpConfigurationRequest.description: Request to create a new MCP configuration

WebhookExecuteRequest.description: Webhook execution request with optional overrides

content.description: The AI's response content, potentially including tool execution results formatted in markdown
content.example:
Based on the Jira ticket DMC-123, here are the details:

## Tools Used
- **jira-get-ticket**: Retrieved ticket information

```json
{"key": "DMC-123", "summary": "Fix login bug"}
```

The ticket shows that...

success.description: Indicates whether the chat request was processed successfully

error.description: Error message if the request failed (null if successful)

ChatResponse.description: Response from the chat API containing the AI's response and execution status

content.example: Can you help me analyze the data from ticket DMC-123?

fileNames.description: List of file names associated with this message (for tracking purposes)

items.description: List of file names associated with this message (for tracking purposes)

ChatMessage.description: Individual message in a chat conversation

messages.description: List of chat messages in the conversation

model.description: AI model to use for the conversation

ai.description: Optional AI integration UUID for selecting specific AI provider

mcpConfigId.description: Optional MCP configuration ID for enabling tool access. When provided, the system can automatically select and execute relevant tools based on conversation context.

ChatRequest.description: Chat request containing messages and optional MCP configuration. The mcpConfigId enables tool integration for enhanced AI responses.

IsLocalResponse.description: Check if user is local response
